meanings.definition: A medical instrument used to examine the ear.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used the otoscope to look inside my ear.
meanings.sent2: The otoscope helped the nurse see if there was an infection in the ear.
meanings.sent3: The otoscope seemed like a tiny flashlight exploring the mysterious depths of the ear.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity was an otoscope, delving into the hidden secrets of the ear canal.
meanings.sent5: The otoscope revealed a world of wonders within the ear, like a tiny explorer on an adventure.

meanings.definition: To examine the ear using an otoscope.
meanings.sent1: The doctor will otoscope your ear to check for any issues.
meanings.sent2: I otoscoped my own ear to see if there was any blockage.
meanings.sent3: She playfully otoscoped her friend's ear, pretending to be a detective on a mission.
meanings.sent4: His gaze otoscoped the room, searching for any signs of trouble.
meanings.sent5: The scientist otoscoped the specimen carefully, like a detective inspecting a crime scene.
